title: 103_hr1406
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF REHABILITATION CREDIT UNDER PASSIVE ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS." discusses the treatment of rehabilitation credit under passive activity limitations. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the $25,000 offset for rental real estate activities. It specifies dollar limitations based on adjusted gross income and exempts low-income housing credits from phaseout. The text chunk discusses limitations on deductions for rental real estate activities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It exempts low-income housing credits from phaseout and specifies dollar limitations based on adjusted gross income. The text discusses a $65,000 limit for rehabilitation credits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This limit applies after the application of subparagraph (A) and exempts certain portions of the passive activity credit from deductions. The text discusses adjustments to adjusted gross income for tax purposes, excluding certain amounts from consideration. Amendments are made to section 469(i)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments are made to section 469(i)(5) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifically regarding reductions for surviving spouse's exemption and adjustments to certain amounts under paragraph (2). Amendments to section 469(i)(5) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include adjustments to certain amounts under paragraph (2), such as changing $50,000 to $100,000 and $32,500 to $65,000. The subsection heading for subsection (i) of section 469 is amended by striking $25,000. These amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 1992, in taxable years ending after that date.
